Name: Physics of the Soul: The Quantum Book of Living, Dying, Reincarnation, and Immortality

ReviewList.Text: I've read a lot of new age books in my 63 years and this maybe the best one yet.  Intelligent explanation of what is really going on in "this" world....

This is the 4th book by physicist Amit Goswami I have read on the subject of universal consciousness. The author is among the many reputable scientists who has an open mind and is beginning to teach the world that the old "Scientific-Materialism" from last century's thinkers has now become obsolete. If you have any doubts about my claim ... read this book!
This is a must book for those into the subject matter, highly researched and disciplined in its approach.  Would recommend reading the glossary for definitions before getting too far into the book.
This book helps to complete the knowledge of the aspiring quantum physicist and is a must read for the open misn
This is a very interesting book, very deep and requires reading a few times more I believe.

The author uses physics to determine the nature of our soul/consciousness and makes great strides towards finding the truth. One unfortunate aspect of the book is that it is not an easy read. Without any background in physics a few sections are almost impossible to follow and understand. I had 2 years of physics in high school and one year in the university and my knowledge is not enough to understand all of it.

I read this book in a class taught by the Author. It is amazing as are his other books. Currently The Center for Spiritual Living South Florida ( in Dania Fl ) is reading this in a class and all are enjoying it. Its substantive but not over most peoples heads.  Really a wonderful read and bound to  give adequate answers to many of Life's big questions.
This is the first book I have read that clearly explains our soul and it's immorality.  It's challenging but totally engaging.
At times I found this author a little hard to follow and sometimes I found myself bored.  It was an insightful book in some areas, but I would not read it again.
